author: bgrgv

comments.body: Hey @bgrgv, thank you for the contribution. We are not going to take this change because, for a small number of choices, a switch is usually better. Also, in this specific case, we want to favor readability, and we believe that the switch makes it a little easier to follow what is going on.

> Hey @bgrgv, thank you for the contribution. We are not going to take this change because, for a small number of choices, a switch is usually better. Also, in this specific case, we want to favor readability, and we believe that the switch makes it a little easier to follow what is going on.

Alright 👍

satisfaction_conditions: Demonstrates why a switch statement is preferable to a Map for small numbers of choices
Addresses the trade-off between code optimization and maintainability
Explains criteria for choosing between data structures and control flow structures
